article_html:
Artist Katrina Palmer, winner of an Artangel/Radio 4 contest to find groundbreaking new art, has made a haunting piece on the Isle of Portland in Dorset, which was photographed for a feature in the New Review. Here, the Horrocks Sisters, eccentric daughters of a dead quarryman, appear as part of the exhibition and then are gone.

Photograph: Sophia Evans for the Observer

text:
Artist Katrina Palmer, winner of an Artangel/Radio 4 contest to find groundbreaking new art, has made a haunting piece on the Isle of Portland in Dorset, which was photographed for a feature in the New Review. Here, the Horrocks Sisters, eccentric daughters of a dead quarryman, appear as part of the exhibition and then are gone.

Photograph: Sophia Evans for the Observer
